cause.description:
The HOPE Program in the Childrens Center for Cancer and Blood Diseases at Childrens Hospital Los Angeles has evolved over the last 30 years and continues to create new and innovative approaches to psychosocial care. Today, HOPE's Center is an international leader in the comprehensive care of children and teens with cancer, together with their families. HOPE provides state-of-the art medical treatment combined with compassionate psychosocial care and support, as well as making scientific discoveries in all facets of the disease and treatment focused on reducing suffering and improving quality of life.
1. We need to give children more HOPE.
cause.mission: To develop and coordinate a complete range of culturally sensitive psychosocial services and educational activities for young people with cancer or blood diseases.
cause.name: Keeping HOPE Alive for Children Around the World
